entries.meaning: (used attributively as a modifier) Of or relating to trousers.
(in clothing retail and fashion) A pair of trousers.
examples: And this is our linen trouser, sir.

verbs.description: trouser (third-person singular simple present trousers, present participle trousering, simple past and past participle trousered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, Britain, Ireland, informal) To put (money) into one's trouser pocket; to pocket.
(transitive, Britain, Ireland, informal) To secretively steal (an item or money) for personal use.
(transitive, Britain, Ireland, informal) To take and keep (something, especially money, that is not one's own); to pocket.
